intro: Albuca scabrocostata, commonly known as the rough-stemmed albuca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
